result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Examining Physician's Report- NGI
NGI
for Examination under SS 971.16, Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis. Stats. (NGI)

2:11 PM Defendant Capreace R Salinas in court.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for Capreace R Salinas.  Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE changing to an NGI plea.  Atty Riek requesting a NGI evaluation. Asking court to appoint.  CT: given the circumstance court will appoint Dr at County Pay.
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $3,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
 - Defendant shall not commit any acts or threats of violence against Shylee D. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2900 block of Providence St in Sun Prairie. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].
 - Defendant shall not have any firearms within their residence.
 - Defendant must follow up with mental health treatment recommendations and medications. NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

10:28 AM Defendant Capreace R Salinas in court.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for Capreace R Salinas.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim statement.   State objecting motion to modify bail.  Defense statement.   Court amends no contact bail addition: no acts or threats of violence against Shylee D.  All other conditions remain as previously set. 

Defense has not gotten an offer from the State.   Court will set for another STC and the State is to provide an offer prior to that.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $15,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shylee D. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2900 block of Providence St in Sun Prairie. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not have any firearms within their residence. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

01:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
